text: Finally a japanese curry restaurant in the nw of the valley. Reminds me of Hawaii. Owner and staff very pleasant. Variety of curry, had katsu curry and hawaiian slush...ono...gotta try it to believe it. 3 diff types curry. All favorable, chicken was crispy and moist,  curry on point.
Fast, good service, friendly chef,  good prices smells great inside first visit they offered taste samples of curries Nice touch!

Located easily off the 95 and Craig, I was pretty excited to try this place out.  What drew me in is the fact that their sign reminded me of Boba Hut.  I then come to find out it's the same owner, I was like "yes!"  The shop itself is a bit small. They do have a few tables to sit but probably not a good idea to dine in if you have a big party.  Although it's small, don't let that deter you from coming here. You can easily take your food and go. 

The ordering process itself is pretty easy. You pick your base, curry, protein, and any extras you would like to add. They offer three different types of curry - Japanese, red, and green.  If you're indecisive, they do offer samples of their curries to try. I wasn't too fond of their green but their Japanese and red curry were both delicious.  So depending if you're in the mood for Japanese or Thai, you have your options covered.

I decided to go with the chicken katsu and Japanese curry, which happens to be the most popular.  The chicken katsu itself, was so yummy. The chicken was moist and tender on the inside and nice and crispy on the outside. The curry had a nice touch of flavor with the right amount of spices and not overpowering. At first glance I thought I was gonna need more sauce but it was more than enough.  The husband ended up getting tako balls and stewed shrimp. I didn't get to taste it but he was completely happy and satisfied with his meal. 

Oh and the fact that we can get our hawaiian slush fix here is an added perk. They don't offer as many boba/drink options as Boba Hut, but enough to satisfy your craving.

Definitely a great addition to the northwest area. I look forward to coming back and trying their red curry.

LOVED THE CURRY SAUCES! The food had an exceptional flavor. The only downfall (hence 3 stars) is that it is expensive. The portion size is not worth it. However, if you get the basic option, it's okay. I also think veggies should be included in your meal. Paying $3 extra to include steamed veggies seems too much.
First time here.  Fabulous food and fabulous service.  Going to be one of my favorite food places.

Came here on the way home from an appointment in North Las Vegas.

Curry Hut is a sister restaurant to Boba Hut in SW Las Vegas, therefore you may see some similarities in some things. 

Curry Hut is located just NW of Craig and 95 behind the McDonalds and some construction. Small restaurant seating about 30 but probably most people would take it to go. 

Simple menu and process

1. Pick a Base - $5.95 - White/Brown rice, French Fries, or Lettuce
2. Pick a Sauce - Japanese/Red/Green Curry
3. Pick Spicy Level - Mild, Medium, Spicy
4. Pick Proteins - EXTRA cost varies per item chosen - Chicken Katsu/Karage, Shabu Shabu Chicken/Beef, Pork Katsu, Kurobuta Sausage, Hamburger Steak, Fried Gyoza/Fish/Shrimp/Tofu, Stewed Shrimp, Lobster/Tako/Fish ball, Potato/Shrimp Croquette, Mix Vegetables
5. Add Extras - EXTRA cost - Kennel corn, cheese, fried egg, spam, extra rice/sauce

I did a simple order of white rice with red curry, spicy w/ pork katsu. 

From order to getting food, was 10 minutes or less. I had my order to-go but it was put in a good quality plastic container with a note reminding you there is possibly a bone in the pork. The cashier also notes that when you order as well ! Good looking out ! ! 

The pork katsu was thinner than expected but i guess for the cook/frying time, they wanted it to be thinner. Wonder if they have thick cut pork katsu? XD 

The red curry was good. Really creamy. Would have wanted it to be a bit spicier, even though i had already ordered spicy. You can tell they used a good amount of coconut milk. Would have preferred a little bit more sauce too. 

Nice to see a curry place pop up on the NW side of town for those deprived of better food, being so far away from central vegas. XD !

This place was very very good!  We will definitely be back and we're so happy it's down the street from us. We ordered the tigers blood slush which was delicious. My fianc√© ordered Japanese curry with white rice, shabu shabu chicken and hamburger steak. I ordered Japanese curry with white rice shabu shabu beef and fish balls. Both were full of flavor and the portion size was very generous. The spam musubi was a hit with my 2 year old. A little bummed that they ran out of lobster balls. Overall, great little curry place!

Oh and don't hesitate to ask for a sample of their curry sauces before you order.
This is my favorite Curry place! Everything is tasty and delicious! Great amount of spice! The Japanese curry was delicious! I had the fish balls and it was so Yummy! Love this place!

Tried their red curry with the potato croquet today and it was delicious! I will definitely be ordering some more curry from this place. The staff was so nice the place is small but cozy with great food.

Was good but they forgot part of my order and had to go back and pick it up. Also didn't remember the quantity.
The prices for the food are alright but the drinks were pricey. Want to put 75 but give them credit for fixing the order.

This is fast food Thai food it's OK in a pinch if you're hungry the prices aren't so badd the special tree drinks are OK the curry flavors are OK and the food is OK again it's fast food Thai food just remember that when coming in

Stoked that there's a new place to get curry AND boba in this part of town, I had to check it out. We both ordered kaarage chicken. Mine with green curry and her's with japanese curry. Both very tasty. I was worried the chicken wouldn't stay crispy due to the curry, but that wasn't the case at all. We tried both the thai slush and tiger's blood slush. Thai slush was okay but the tiger's blood was just way more flavorful. But tiger's blood is not for you if you don't like very sweet and fruity drinks because we were told by staff that we cannot alter sweetness level for slushies. We had 10% off because they were doing a promotional sale and recieved complementary gyoza which was crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. On a separate occasion, we tried their lobster balls which were buttery and filling. Very happy with both visits and will come again.

I have to say, I am highly impressed with this restaurant as a whole. Decor is clean, food is excellent, customer service is on point. My friend and I were offered samples (as it was our first visit) and we were given a complete run down of the menu. Super friendly! We got our food surprisingly quick for being cooked fresh, and it was absolutely delicious! We shared a plate of chicken Katsu with white rice and the green curry. It does have some spice, but I would consider it quite mild. They serve the food in reusable containers, which I think is pretty cool. 11/10, would eat here again! (We had eaten half our food before I remembered I wanted to take a picture, so I took a photo of the red curry plate)

This was surprise dinner, and was I surprised. Curry Hut is an extension of Boba Hut. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. They not only offer curry combination bowls, but also offer an array of boba milk teas and slushees. Curry Hut is a must if you are in the area. If not grub hub delivers.

I had just eaten before I had gone here so I can't say anything about the curry...yet, but what attracted me to this place was the boba. I am a boba addict and wanted a nice treat after recently eating lunch with my mother in law. The cashier greeted us and explained the whole process to us as soon as we entered! Her attitude was super welcoming and nice! The other two employees working as well were very patient and attentive, all three of them offered samples and even gave us detailed explanations on different things we had never heard of or tried, like the crystal boba and cheese cream (both delicious). The overall experience was amazing and their boba tea was yummy! I would definitely return for the drinks and would love to try the curry next time. All I can say is amazing customer service and delicious boba!

Great tasting curry from Japanese to Thai Curry with many different options to add with your meal. They also have boba tea and other specialty drinks. My wife and I loved the curry and the customer service is too notch with friendly management and staff. Check this place out. It is a great place to dine or take to go.

First off I spent 15 mins putting an order in online but I ended up calling because I wanted to pay in person so I could use the 10% discount and was told that they do not do online ordering and that I should not have been able to put the order in. So not sure if this is an issue with the Yelp app or their system, but I recommend just calling to place your order. 

The curry itself is not bad but I do find other places to be better. Cons:
-small overall portion for the price 
-they gave us very little curry barely enough for the rice itself let alone the proteins 
-takoyaki was mostly dough and no mayo on top and had that freezer smell to it 
-the girl that packed our order threw the takoyaki in the bag and tied it up so tightly that the box flipped and it ended up looking real gross 
-they put the red pickles right into the curry for my meal while they put it on the rice for my friends meal, so my pickles were hot and soaked in curry which I did not like 
-they gave us sweet chili sauce for gyoza instead of  gyoza sauce??

This place is super close to my work so if I was craving curry I would come again but definitely not my first choice for curry.

Curry Hut offers a great curry menu with many choices on the proteins. The Lobster Ball & Chicken Katsu with curry over the rice makes it the best combo plate. Got to try the rest of the menu next time. Glad to have Curry Hut in our neighborhood.

Wow! Curry Hut hit the spot. Finally a place in the Northwest with excellent curry and sides.  Had pork cutlet w/Japanese curry and the Takoyaki(octopus balls) on point! Great service too Definitely will be going back.

First time here. 

Customer service was great. Food was on point. Fast service. 

Hawaii peeps, if you miss Curry House from back home CURRY HUT is the place to come! They have Japanese curry, red curry and Thai curry to choose from. 

No fountain drinks but you could purchase can or bottle drinks. 

I give Curry Hut Five stars because they were awesome on customer service, food came out at a timely manner and the flavor was there.

I taste tested all their curries and they were all good.  They did use too much cheese but that was minor.  The wife also ordered a salad and we expected an Asian style salad but it was just a bunch of lettuce and not an Asian dressing so we didn't eat it.  I would come back here again.

We tried this place for the first time and it was really good. The staff was super friendly and helpful. We had Japanese curry with chicken Katsu. The chicken was super crispy, we just wished the sauce would have been a bit more spicy, but we will make to ask for extra spicy next time. Overall it was a great experience and we will definitely go back.

The Japanese curry sauce is delicious and vegetarian. I wish that the Thai curries could be made without fish sauce, because they would go very well with Curry Hut's flavorful fried tofu. Vegan Thai food is hard to find in this part of town. They also make some of the best milk teas and boba I've tried recently.  

For a very casual and mostly take out place, the price of a meal is a little high. It starts at $5.95 for any sauce on your choice of base (salad, french fries, white or brown rice.) The salad greens were very good quality and fresh! Each additional ingredient, protein, vegetable, or garnish is charged separately, so a more complex dish could be pricey. It's easy to spend $15+ for lunch here on a basic curry plate with a milk tea. I'm used to having leftovers when I order Thai food, but the portions here aren't that generous. 

Just a note if you're dining with little ones: the high chair is broken. The front bars and seat belt appeared to be missing. Hopefully, they'll get a replacement.

I was in the mood for some curry and I saw that this place just opened so I decided to check it out. As I walked up to the door, I noticed the place was very updated in terms of the decor. I checked out their menu and asked the cashier what to get as it was my first time here. He suggested Chicken karaage with Japanese curry. I ordered that along with boba milk tea and lobster balls. My order came out in a timely manner. The milk tea was very rich in tea flavor and the chicken karaage was very crispy and juicy. The Japanese curry had good consistency and flavor. Lobster balls were fresh and definitely my favorite. All in all, I would definitely repeat whenever I need my curry fix.
Yum. Everything was really great, big portions. They're open late on Friday/Saturdays too.

I've tried every Japanese curry restaurant in Las Vegas, and unfortunately Curry Hut is the worst one by far. The food is honestly just not good. The curry is bland, and the chicken cutlet was overcooked. My table ordered one of each, a mild, medium, and spicy curry. They all tasted exactly the same. No flavor, no spice, and a bad cutlet. 
The presentation is terrible. Everything is served in plastic to-go containers with plastic cutlery. It feels like they're immediately trying to push you out the door, especially since the dining area is so small and cramped. 
My last complaint is with the service. I made a single special request with my order: no red pickles. What do I see on every single plate when my food was ready? Red pickles. 
I will not be returning to Curry Hut. The food and service all left me incredibly dissatisfied.

I popped in to try this place, as it had good reviews and was close by. I normally do not eat curry but the Katsu chicken with red curry was amazing! The customer service was top notch and super friendly. The price is good and the quantity was more than enough for me. I reserve 5 stars for rare occurences so I give this place 4 stars only because of that!

First timer ! It was really good. A bit pricey but food didn't disappoint. I sampled the three different curries and they were all really good. I ended up going with the red curry with chicken karaage and shabu shabu chicken. It had the right amount of kick to it. Had to also get sample the spam musubi and the spam to rice ratio was decent (It matters to some people). Also got some boba- tried the tigers blood and the Hawaiian. Both were delicious. Will definitely try again.

1. Great customer service - gave us free lobster balls to try since they are such a new business 
2. Delicious Japanese curry - solid flavor with generous portion of sauce 
3. Good vibe for conversation 
4. Many options for toppings and proteins with vegetarian options
5. Aesthetically pleasing drinks that also taste good

We would definitely come back!

Right when we walked in this friendly worker greeted us and offered us samples of the curry. She was super nice and very helpful as it was our first time here. When our food came we had another guy come and ask about if we were enjoying our food as well as the first worker. Their customer service is awesome and I would definitely come again!

I usually do not do a review the first time I visit but this place is exceptionally delicious. It hasn't officially opened but you can stop by and get yourself a quick bite. If you're familiar with the Boba Hut then you'll love Curry Hut. Food is great, atmosphere is inviting and prices are reasonable.

Hungry for a healthy meal post workout, next door we went! A chicken bowl with spicy Japanese curry hit the spot! The friendly girl who took our order got me samples of all three sauces to try...they were all delicious! The veggies in the chicken bowl were cooked perfectly (al dente) and the brown rice left nothing to be desired...it was a satiating meal in a bowl with plenty left for lunch. Highly recommended. Oh yeah, be sure to order a fried hard boiled egg in your bowl. I'll be back. For sure.

After having curry zen for so long this a refreshing break! Glad to have a curry place, you have three different choices of curry; Japanese curry, red curry, and green curry. All three are great! I went for the Japanese curry with pork Katy's and my gf picked the green curry with shabu shabu beef + stewed shrimp. Great place, brand new, definitely will be coming back!
The curry is yummy and they have a pretty good menu. I thought the green tea latte was matcha, so when I tried it, it was a bit of a let down, but it was still yummy.

The food is delicious! I love getting the chicken Katsu with rice and the least spicy curry! The staff is very friendly and even though it's on the other side of town from where I live, I always go back!

The food is great, nicely priced and the service is amazing! Kimbryanna is really helpful and attentive to the guests! She made the experience a lot better than just any regular dining facility! I would highly recommend this place!

Excellent service, excellent food, fair prices. We came here on a Saturday for lunch. We werent sure what to order, but they let us try all three curries beforehand and made recommendations which was so helpful. They have so many protein options and they all sounded deliI got the chicken katsu with white rice and green curry - delicious! My only suggestion is that both the red and green curries were too spicy for my liking - if they made them SUPER mild and then allowed each customer to customize the spice level, that would work for those of us who cant take the heat! I also ordered a green lantern tea with lychee jelly (customized with 0% extra sweetness) and was blown away - YUM. I cant wait to come back, especially to try more teas!

Update:
We have now ordered delivery from here too and it is better and better every time! They now allow you to customize spicy level and even serve the sauce on the side so that it doesnt get soggy in transport. The teas come in super sturdy plastic to-go cups that look so professional. This place knows how to impress!

This place was a pleasant surprise! Conveniently located off of Craig Rd/95 fwy; you won't have to deal with a crowded parking lot. I had the Japanese curry with tofu and vegetables. The curry was thick and it had good flavor. The dish would be better if the tofu was served 'katsu' style to pair nicely with the Japanese curry, but it was only pan-fried. Aside from my personal preference, it tasted good.

Customer service was awesome! The manager took his time to explain the menu items and he made sure I was comfortable with my order. He also politely asked if I wanted to taste a sample of the curry. The food came out in less than 5 minutes--excellent!

Couple of things I wish they had: 1) ability to raise the spice level, 2) more condiments to add to my dish, traditional Japanese and Thai style. 

Nice addition to the Northwest! Give them a try :)

This place is great! Japanese curry with chicken Katsu was on point! Been here a few times and never a bad meal! Hubby likes the other red & green curry but Japanese on is my fav! Cannot wait to try more things!

I ordered pick up through the app since I had $2 off (it's great when you sign up for yelps newsletter) and bcs they are a new place close to my moms place - I wanted to give them a try. 

I ordered the beef shabu shabu with medium Japanese curry and a chicken karage with mild Japanese curry.  I had them put the curry on the side bcs I didn't want the rice to soak up all the curry since we weren't going to eat it right away.  

The karage pieces were a bit underwhelming at first  and a lil too small for my taste.  They were one biters and after a while I kinda liked that one bite taste and texture.  So maybe they are on to something.  
Ok so the shabu shabu beef was kinda weird... the one we are use to in Hawaii is really thinly sliced and it was just meat and curry.  Curry Hut had put in onions and peppers and we had to dig them out.  Also the meat was sliced a little too thick and tasted old.  The rice also tasted old like it's been 2 days since they cooked it.  He also felt like there wasn't enough curry because he didn't have enough to cover his rice.  For me the curry was just enough bcs I don't cover my rice, as I try not to eat too much rice.  So next time I'll get extra curry for him.  I did feel bad for my boyfriend bcs his favorite curry is the shabu shabu and no other curry place in Vegas carries that.  He was pretty disappointed with his plate but he was hungry and he ate it.  I hope he doesn't get an upset stomach from the old meat and rice.

Last thing I got was the Hawaiian slushie and that thing did not disappoint!  It was tasty, cold and refreshing.  Would love to try the other flavors soon. 

All in all the shabu beef was a miss but my chicken was ok.  The curry was good, like the stuff out of the box.  The slushie was excellent and I'll be trying that boba stuff next. 
This is not like Curry House out in Hawaii (which we loved) but it's a nice place to pick up some curry if I don't wanna cook.  I just might have to cook my own rice and just ask for some French fries.
Super good!!!! I love this place! I will be ordering again. I've never had curry food this is a 1st.
So happy I do t have to drive all the way across town for some boba. Sampled all the curry and they were all great. Had a hard time choosing. Can't wait to go back.

GOOD FOOD. GREAT SERVICE.

Food was good. Our favorite was the green curry.  The cut of beef they use doesn't do their great tasting curry any justice. I understand that more premium cuts lowers the profit margin but that makes the difference between a three star review and a five star review.

The service was exceptional. We were impressed with the attention the staff gave us. Staff was very friendly.
All three curry sauces are great! Love how easy the menu makes it to put together exactly what you want. Good options for vegetarians with the Japanese curry.

I was excited to see a Japanese curry restaurant on the northwest side of town . It was delicious and service was great. We even got goyza on the house. Teas were delicious and curry was awesome. We got the green curry with vegetables and tofu , green curry with chicken and Japanese curry with vegetables and potatoes. We will be back !

Have been waiting for this place to open for a while now! I was crossing my fingers they would have vegan options, which they do. 
They just opened, so gotta give them some room to get acclimated.
Great place for meat-eaters, husband loved the food.
As for vegans, the Japanese curry has no animal products accroding to the workers and is quite delicious. For plant based toppings they have tofu and veggies, they also have croquet potatoes but I am not sure if these are vegan. 
Essentially you build your dish. Pick a base: white rice, brown rice, salad, or french fries. Then you pick your toppings and curry. I did french fries and veggies with Japanese curry. The curry was delicious, the veggies nuce and fresh, next time I will get brown rice, as french fries were an odd mix to the dish. But overall quite delicious!
The workers were very friendly and attentive. Will be back! Just wish all 3 curries were vegan! :)
Japanese style curry. What more can you want? Friendly service and food that's hard to get in town. Best casual Japanese restaurant in town.

Excellent service and food was delicious. I had the spicy Japanese curry with shabu shabu chicken. The level of spicy would be around 6-7. Decent sized portions at reasonable price depending on what extras you get.
The food was amazing!! I got the Japanese curry with brown rice and tofu! Amazing prices also and great service. Will definitely be back.

This has been one of the best curry places we been too! I love the fact that they have so much options for protein and curry as well! The staff was very helpful and super nice! We will be coming in again soon :)
This is a bad place to eat. It is dirty and the food is too greasy. The employees are treated badly. Everyone is stressed and resentful

If your familar with Boba Hut in the Southwest part of the valley. Curry Hut is the second location for the owners who decided to set up shop in the growing Northwest side of town. This fast casual restaurant is quite small with approximately 6 tables and seating for about 20ppl. Its small and not reccommended for large groups. However, its an ideal place to grab food on the go. Curry Hut, focuses on Japanese and Thai Curry. The counter service restaurant is designed so that your able to BYO-Build Your Own dish with Bases, Proteins, Sauces and toppings. They also have various boba drinks and smoothies.

Onto, the food; I got Chicken Katsu w/ Japanese Curry for my protein and sauce with white rice as my base and added a fried hard boiled egg. One word, Wow! My Japanese Curry was prepared hot and fresh, my chicken Katsu was consistent without being too soggy and the curry sauce was spot on delicious. A good hint of spices and the curry sauce wasn't runny or too chunky, the texture of the sauce paired well with my white rice. 

This will definitely be a popular place with the suburbanites in the area. Specially for those looking for a quick and delicious meal. I'm quite pleased with my experience and will be making a return visit soon!

2018 Yelp Review #24
Found a new favorite place to eat! Already went twice this week and will be coming here often. The curry is so good and they boba as well. Customer service is great!

I have been waiting for them to open and I am not disappointed. The curries are amazing, the portions are great and the quality is very high. They even treated us to a gyoza. Super start and happy to become a regular!!!

So I went to this place with a friend for the first time and we both didnt like it! We both had the chicken katsu curry with our own additional toppings. Toppings itself were 3.95 or 4.95 extra!! To me thats expensive! I love curries and ive been to other curry places and this curry hut does not make the cut for me:)

Third visit in a row that the food was absolutely terrible! Curry Hut used to be my absolute favorite place to eat. Very disappointed with both food and service lately. I'm beginning to think that this isn't just a one off, but rather a decline in quality.
Today I got the brown rice, green curry, and chicken katsu with lobster balls on the side. The brown rice was very very dry and seemed over-cooked. There was a bunch of very raw onions! Raw onions are totally inedible. The chicken and sauce were OK, but very skimpy compared to past orders and certainly NOT amazing as it used to be. The lobster balls were decent at least.
Not sure I'm willing to risk coming here anymore.

Okay! Let's get it started!

Vibe, service, and food... Shall We?

Vibe: 
It's a pretty small set up in all honesty. There were about 6 tables but the set ups are limited from 2 to 4 chairs. This place is probably not that great for big groups but it's definitely cozy. 

Service:
The service was excellent! Everyone was nice and helpful. Most importantly... They were quick, efficient, and friendly. Absolutely in love with the service.

Now for the most important part...

Food:
The food was pretty good I gotta say. I tried the katsu, lobster balls, and karage. The karage was good and seasoned well. The Katsu was pretty crunchy which I love and breading didn't fall off. Now, I've never had lobster balls before so I wasn't prepared for what it was. I automatically thought it'd be pretty similar to takoyaki but it was pretty dense. The taste was good though. The curry was nice and flavorful but I have to honest I wish that they put a bit more. 

Overall, the food is good and the service is superb but the price is definitely a little high for what you get. I recommend this place to try and you might find a good place to go for lunch

Curry Hut opened a little while ago and my husband wanted to try it. He craves food from back home... The restaurant is clean. The cashiers were friendly. The food itself was good. What made our experience great was the ?owner let us sample the chicken karaage. The cashier offered to let us try the 3 types of curry they carry but we already knew we wanted the Japanese style. The ?owner also gave a sample drinks at the end of our meal. That was a nice appreciated gesture. I hope they do well and last a long time. We'll be back when we want our curry fix! :)

I'm a big fan of their drinks, specifically the specialty ones, Hawaiian being my favorite because it has li hing mui powder in it!

The food is good but it does get pricey as you start to add on additional toppings.  But all I need is rice, pork, Japanese curry, and optional lobster balls.

It's weird though, the pork is sometimes cut and sometimes it's uncut with bone in.

Yes! A curry place in the northwest area! This location just recently opened up and we went for their grand opening and love it! We got a sample of all of their different curries and I believe the red curry is the best. It was so rich in flavor, even a bit of a kick to it. I got it with the chicken katsu and that was good also. We ordered boba drinks and even at 25% sweet, they were amazing. The staff are super friendly and willing to give you samples of things. We'll probably be visiting here frequently as it's down the street from work and on the way home =)

We were pleasant surprised... they allowed us to try all the curries to help us with our decision when ordering, they were friendly, the food tasted great and appropriately proportioned, the boba and teas were also very good and in cute cups! Winner!

They offered to try all three curries. I'm glad I did because originally I was going to get Japanese Curry but changed my mind after trying them. They were all good but I really liked the sweetness of the green curry. It was delish. Added chicken katsu, gyoza, fried shrimp, and lobster balls. Tigers blood drink was the best !! Def coming back again!!

Friendly services! What drew me into this establishment was the smell of delightful Katsu Chicken. Realized that I started my diet I didn't want any carbs so the Owner Roldan suggest Pickle Ginger Chicken Katsu Salad (as seen on my picture) it was the most satisfying salad I've ever had. It was filling but didn't make me feel bloated. I would differently recommend it if you're on a low carb diet with a tasty treat!

It was nice to find this place up here in the northwest part of the city. The restaurant is in a strip mall off Craig Rd near the 95. The place it self is not to big with only about six tables for people to sit at. I ordered my food to go and it was ready quick and with no issues. The staff are friendly and the place looked very clean. The curry was good as well as the gyoza that we had. We will be making trips here in the future.

Interesting little place - you order your base, Curry, protein and sides. It's slightly pricey, but in my vast experience curry always is.  I lucked out and got the    bowl with white rice, green curry and pork katsu; the green curry was frk'n awesome! They also have lots of boba and smoothie drinks, but I wanted a plain, unsweetened iced tea, which they don't have.  The counter girl was VERY helpful and suggested a green ice tea with cucumber juice in it. When I got it she said it's not very sweet but they can add sweet if needed... it was PERFECT, refreshing, ice cold.  I loved it, please don't be deterred by the look, it was fantastic.  Anyway, very good meal, I left happy, but I could see where the order price could sore if you get all the adds to your bowl... like Lobster Balls.  But, I am getting them next time  :)
Staff was super friendly and inviting and my order was made very prompt. I ordered the red curry with chicken Katsu and brown rice.. Definitely would order it again and definitely will be back!

Yesterday was my first experience at a Japanese Curry spot and I'm sooooo glad I gave it a try. I dont have anywhere else to compare it to but I'm sold with the flavors alone. 

It's a small place in a shopping plaza with plenty of parking. I walked in, was immediately greeted, and then asked if I have ever tried Japanese curry and needed help with the menu. I was like yes! Help me haha. The girl was awesome but I didnt see a name tag. If the owners read this, they should know the young lady who worked on Monday around 3pm was absolutely amazing! She went above and beyond when it came to explaining the menu and flavor profiles plus giving me her recommendations. 

I was able to sample all the different curries...AWESOME. I chose the Japanese curry this time but definitely want the green curry on my next stop. I went with the chicken katsu which was crispy and delicious and also the lobster balls. They were good but I don't think I will order them again. My food partner ordered the hamburger steak and added a deep fried egg and loved it all. To wash it all down I went with the Green Lantern which was perfect and delicious. 

I'll probably be back here soon because I want to try a couple different things including their smoothies.  Overall the food was delicious with huge portions and customer service was great .

Curry Hut just opened up in the neighborhood and overall it was yummy!  

Items tried and liked (so far): 
Japanese Curry - A little sweet with a hint of spice just as a Japanese should taste.
Chicken Katsu - Perfect thickness, well seasoned & crispy.
Gyoza - Basic yummy gyoza. 
Lobster Balls - Fish cake style that is deep fried. 
Hawaiian Slush - The combo of ice, mango, pineapple & li hing powder reminds me so much Hawaii :) 

Place is cute, clean & cozy. There are approximately 6 tables in total. Luckily when we went there was no line and a couple of empty tables but soon after the place filled up quickly with customers ordering take-out and dining in. 

Service was excellent. Everyone was very nice, helpful & friendly :)  Cashier was very nice & patient and answered everyone's questions.  One of the owners came out to ask us how our food was which was really nice. Also forgot to mention that they are the same owners of Boba Hut on S. Rainbow. 

Another great addition to the Northwest area and will definitely be back!

Ordered for the first time from Door Dash- SO
YUMMY! For my fellow vegans out there, the Japanese curry is vegan! I got brown rice, Japanese curry, mixed veggies, corn, fried tofu with mild spice. Everything is hot and flavorful. Portions are pretty large as well. Nice selection of veggies and all cooked through perfect. Love the salty little red things on the side as well.. not sure what they are but they're delicious lol. Definitely will order from here again!

Found this place on Yelp and decided it was worth a try ... so glad I did! on my visit, the cashier Kim asked me if it was my first time. When I told her it was, she offered me a sample of all 3 sauce options at their standard spice level so that I could taste them . She explained each sauce and their standard mix ins. She also offered suggestions based on what I said that I had tried before. my order didn't take long at all .... I waited 5 minutes tops! I ordered the green curry with brown rice and shabu shabu chicken w/ a tiger's blood slush. it was AMAZING! she also gave me a punch card that gets you $3.50 off when you dine with them 10 times. Overall it was a great experience ... I will definitely be back!

Try all 3 flavors of curry before ordering.  I did and had the hardest choice because they all taste great.  

I went with brown rice with red curry and chicken Katsu...the food was super flavorful veggies were fresh. 

Depending on your appetite you might be able to split this between 2 people.

Finally , a good curry fusion twist in North Las Vegas.  I'm tired of going all the way to China town to eat so this place was a good location for me. The owner gave me me excellent customer service and was very friendly giving my daughter a free smoothie. The food was great, good price , big portions , with 3 choices of curry sauce and tons of toppings to choose from. I also found Curry Hut on Postmates. Will definately be back again. Love to support local business.  Thank you !!!

Second time and just as good if not better than the first time.  Had the Japanese curry and red curry mixed, chicken katsu with veggies. Chicken katsu was crispy and juicy.  Fried shrimp was really good too.  Absolutely will be coming back and recommending to friends!

Stumbled upon this place by mistake but I have no regrets.  Staff were great & patient with all 12 of us who were there together.  Offered us to try the different curries.   Would definitely go again.  Just sad that it's not close to my area.  I didn't have a personal favorite, I love them all.

Great service and food!  Helped us figure out a bunch of things we've never had before and it was all outstanding food.  This place brings several new flavors to the north side of town.  Great find, happy customer!

Having lived in Japan for 2 years, I have become a curry and ramen addict. I was excited when driving by to see the Curry Hut sign. I am also a fan of Zen curry however this is dangerously close to home. I had the spicy Japanese curry with white rice, potato croquette and hamburger steak. The rice was perfect, the curry perfectly spicy, the croquette exactly what I would expect and the hamburger absolutely fantasticly juicy! The portion is a little on the small side by American standards but I actually appreciate that. They threw in a couple Gyozas that were also quite tasty. Curry Hut exceeded my expectations and I'll definitely be back. Thank you!

Had a bowl of white rice and Japanese curry with chicken katsu, sausage, and a fried egg. Everything was delicious and flavorful. The owner was very friendly and welcoming. Will definitely be returning.

I was getting McDonald's one time a couple weeks ago and saw their huge sign and got hyped immediately!
I received the notification that they had opened but before that a few of my co-workers told me that this place was open!

I just arrived from LA and needed a quick dinner, and I immediately thought about this place. 
I'm so glad they have an official curry place so close to my condo!

As soon as I entered I was greeted with such excitement and at the time they had a full house! It was raining hard that day and the door was open, I could smell the food from across the street and I just felt right at home.

The curry was amazing, and every bite made me want more! 

Will be back soon!

Not bad. Also not great. 

Curry is a little sweet and bland. Doesn't have a strong enough spice presence, either in the curry base or the heat level you can choose. 

The fukujinzuke (red pickles) was a bit softer than I prefer, but was good and I'm glad it existed to begin with. 

Pork Katsu was nice. No complaints. 

Fish balls weren't quite what I expected, a bit more springy and dense than I'd anticipated, I'm used to a little more ground vs solid texture. Plenty fishy, decent. 

The proportion seemed a little off, I never run out of rice but had a few pieces of katsu left over. Maybe I just wasn't paying attention. More rice isn't usually what I want. 

Final part of my order was a matcha latte. Distinctly matcha flavored. I got it 75% sweetened, I'd go whole hog 100% if I were to do it over again. 

Nice take-out plate, I'm considering saving it for reuse like my mother would. Haha

In the end, this is sort of the Chipotle edition of Japanese curry. Not bad, but not that close to the original either in quality or enjoyability. Even though it's close to my house, I don't think this will be repeat. I'll drive 20 minutes to the original Zen location I've been going to since it opened. Worth the try, not bad, but not good enough to save me driving much farther for much better.

First time here today and surprisingly it was really close to where I live. I feel like this location will do very good knowing they serve brown rice for the fit people next door keeping there body in shape..anyways overall food was great and we got on the house poke bowl! The taro cream drink was also super good! They also gave a soft opening discount meaning we came here before the restaurants launch. I'd be coming here again oh and not to mention March 22nd is there grand opening and they're giving away free iPhone cases with any purchase! So be here or be square!

Let me start by saying that Kim was amazing.  She was extremely knowledgeable and made great recommendations for the food including preparation and dietary restrictions.  For a quick service location she even came back to the table to ask how we liked everything and her associate offered water refills.  Her service alone made the trip worthwhile.

Food was good -  a lighter version of curry but flavorful. Veggies were fresh and crispy.  I love the potato cake with Panko crust and carrots in it.  

Overall a good experience and would come back again for a quick bite.

Super tasty and crispy Japanese style curry with bonus awesome Boba. Try the fried fish it was amazingly well prepared. Be sure to request a sample of the curry sauces, they are all excellent but very different. Great and friendly service. Clean establishment. Dangerous because it is just a few blocks away from home! (dangerous as we will be tempted to return!)

I was anxiously waiting for this place to open since its right across the street from me. I got too excited and forgot to take pics of my food. ):

But anyway!
It was pretty good! There are SO MANY choices to add on to your curry. I wanted to go crazy on adding things lmao. 

So I'm a huge zen curry fan. I go at least once a week lmao. So I was pretty scared but to my surprise, I enjoyed it very much! The flavor was all there. I personally would have preferred a thicker japanese curry but it was still delicious. 

The pork katsu was super juicy and nice and crispy. Awesome! And thank God they have good fukujinzuke (pickled red radish). I love that stuff so much that if it wasn't good, I would not go back lol.

Drinks! 
Creamy taro boba, perfect. Their honey boba melts in your mouth, as it should! I'm also picky about my boba.  The crystal boba was good too but maybe just not for me. I've never had crystal boba before so it's hard to rate it. Matcha drink was yummy though. 

The place.
Super clean ofc. You can tell it's more of a to go place. And they do give good quality to go boxes. Not the styrofoam ones lol. The staff was wonderful. No complaints!
I really enjoyed the green curry. It was spicy and I love spicy. The atmosphere is blah,  I wanted to go somewhere else to eat based off of that. The food was very good!!

Amazing Japanese curry! Had rice as my base and added pork katsu and fried tofu. Comes with ginger. So awesome. Finally somewhere GREAT on the north side of town. Excited to try the boba. 10/10. Good portion size.

Great Curry, Great customer service. I got red curry, with fried shrimp, sausage, and brown rice , husband got green curry, brown rice and shabu shabu beef. We were both very pleased with portion size and flavor. Ordered drinks , they gave us wrong ones, the lady called us back and apologized, even though I should have noticed they werent correct, and we get free drinks next time we come in.
Loved this place! The food was so good, affordable & the owner brought a bunch of samples to the table.  We will definitely be back!!!

I thought it's a cheap taste curry place, but, curry is really really delicious, omg. !!!
Makes my belly happy. 

I just knew the dishes is prepared by the famous chef in Las Vegas top restaurant.
This is amazing curry food,Easy for parking., The floor is very clean. Food  tastes good.Highly recommend.
From out of town and wanted Japanese food. This place delivered earlier than my estimated time. The food is warm and taste very good! The delivery guy was really nice.

So good! Friendly staff, quick service and really good curry. 
The presentation is simple.  On our first visit in they let us test all three curry flavors . They were each different and it was hard to choose. From there you can add your spice level. 
We tried the the chicken katsu and the fried shrimp. 
Happy to see a new restaurant in this area and we will definitely be back. 
Prices are reasonable
Good Curry for pick up. One of our regularly pick ups. Try the drink menu it will keep you coming back for more.

This just became a new favorite for my family. We were talking about coming back again before we even got our food. After sampling the sauce, we knew the rest to follow was going to be amazing. The staff were all friendly and so helpful, too!

I ordered the vegetarian Japanese curry with brown rice and chicken, but there are so many protein and add-in options as well. We also tried the house milk tea and the Tiger's Blood slush, both of which were customizable and so tasty. 

We will be heading back to this spot for sure!

Decided to check this place out. Awesome service from the point of walking in. Cashier knew everything on the menu and was super friendly. I ordered the chicken katsu with Japanese curry and the chicken was cooked perfectly. They are thoughtful with their to go orders as well putting the curry on the side. Also ordered a strawberry smooth and it was smooth

The green curry had all the flavors I love and expected, the portion was decent for the price, and it was only a moderate wait to get my food. Food wise my only complaint is that I wish the curry was a little thicker. What makes this place a 5 star is the service. The girls at the counter were very friendly and informative on what all the options were. They offered samples of each curry, so you could be able to pick one you actually like. I ordered a slushie Thai tea, and they let me know they had run out of one of their flavor mixes. They said they could make a slightly different version and if I didn't like it they would make me something else. Very cool and considerate. The girls also ended up bringing a free sample of the fish ball protien to try.

I've been to Curry Hut twice so far and both experiences were great! I tried their Japanese curry, Okonomiyaki Chicken Katsu (highly recommend), and their boba milk tea. The service was great, even though the restaurant is not designed for sit-in.

This is the cutest most delicious place. I am so happy they opened right near my house. Kim helped me out today and she was just so delightful. She walked me through the menu and even let me try the different types of curry (they were all delicious). She offered us water and was so punctual on refills. Food was great tasting and a great price. Definitely coming back!!

This food is so amazing. I am literally dancing in my seat with each bite. I have the biggest smile on my face. Thank you to all my fellow yelpers that helped me decide to come here and I appreciate it from the bottom of my heart. From a chocolate thick girl that loves food. I will definitely be back
Great food, reasonable prices and outstanding service was my experience. I will definitely be going back!

I'm from Hawaii so my taste buds can NOT be bamboozled when it comes to Curry. I was very disappointed in the food here. It had a rubbery texture and not very flavorful. BUT!! Being from Hawaii, I know good boba and let me tell you! This place has BOMB boba drinks! Tigers blood is delicious but don't get it super sweet, it's a bit much. My fav is Taro slushee with honey boba and lychee jelly. I also loved their matcha slushee. But seriously, does it really take 30 mins to blend a dink? Every time we come here, line or no line, we are always waiting AT LEAST 30 mins. For 4 Drinks! One time I even called ahead of time and they gave said ready in 20 mins, I get there and wait 30 MINUTES! Why even?!With that being said, Food and timeliness gets 1 Star, boba gets 5 stars so we'll settle at 3.

I saw a curry place was opening up when I was going to work a few weeks ago, and this weekend I saw that it was open.

The service was great! The staff was helpful, and said if I needed to adjust my drink sweetness they would accommodate me.

I ordered brown rice with chicken katsu and medium Japanese curry, and a side of french fries. The fries probably could have used a few more seconds in the fryer cause it wasn't as crispy as it could be.


Curry Hut has spicy levels from mild, medium and spicy. I should have gotten spicy cause the medium didn't have any spice kick for me. 

I was a bit skeptical on getting boba here because usually restaurants don't have good boba. 

But the boba was cooked perfectly and was chewy! I got the house milk tea. It did have a lot of ice though, that when I poked the straw in, the straw wouldn't go down all the way, and the tea started overflowing. 

I'd go back!
So good! Service was on point as well. This place is up there with some of the best Japanese curry spots in town.
I ordered off of Uber eats and it tastes amazing but for 15 dollars you would think you would get more then three shrimps with my order

I went to Curry Hut with the family for a quick lunch.
There were only few tables and may be around 20 seats.
The way you order is first decide the base(white rice, brown rice, fries and lettuce. Then choose which curry you want(Japanese, red, green curry), then choose the spicy level (mild, medium, hot). After that you can pick your proteins, they have many selections. And you can add extras like corn, extra rice etc...
We ordered 4 plates of curry and fries and fried gyoza and fries for one my kids who doesn't like curry.
Things I like:
The service was pretty good. When we got there the cashier gave us an introduction on how to order and curry samples so we can taste the curry before decide which one we would like to order. And she brought us our food and gave us plenty of napkin and refilled our water promptly. 

Things were just okay:
We ordered green and Japanese curry. Okay flavor for the curry and green curry probably was the best tasting one.
The katsu chicken and pork were tough and chewy.

Overall the place was okay for a quick bite if you were hungry for curry and didn't want to drive too far for better curry.

Tried Curry Hut for the first time last night, and it was an awesome experience. I love Japanese and Thai curry, so having a place with both options is perfect in my book. First off, the food itself was delicious and a good size portion. I chose a Japanese curry with brown rice and chicken katsu. Let me tell you, they do not skimp on the chicken pieces, which is great. The quality of the food was spot on. Now onto the service. The employees were friendly and accommodating. We were welcomed with smiles and served with genuine care. I definitely enjoyed Curry Hut, and will be returning!

This place has good, fresh and healthy make-it-yourself food and drink that are delicious.  You select what you want and they serve you a big bowl of whatever concoction you have selected.  I like the katsu and wash it down with a Green Lantern.  The price is right and the service is good.  I add corn and veggies to the coconut curry selection for a wonderful meal.  Fine fast food friends.

Would have given this a 5, except one dish we ordered was excellent and the other was pretty bad. First off, waitress was GREAT and super friendly, 5-Star she offered us a sampler for being first time customers nice! Second, service was fast and much appreciated thanks to her. Curry wise, we love the Japanese and red curry. Protein wise, the chicken karaage she recommended was EXCELLENT! We also ordered the pork katsu and that was HORRIBLE, I thought I was going to break a tooth eating it.
Really good boba and curry! If you just want boba and a snack definitely try the curry spam musubi.

Went to curry hut for the first time to stay and I am definitely going back! Walking in looking dazed and confused the nice lady said "here are some taste of our curries!" Right away. I got the green curry with fried like chicken 2 scoops of white rice and onions and peppers. Curry had a nice coconut and spice flavor and was great texture! Very fresh and good all for huts $10 also generous portion for the price they are quick to definitely give them a shot!
OMG! I've been craving Japanese curry and this place definitely satisfied it! Reminds me so much of Curry House in Hawai'i  also they sell boba and other drink options like teas & lattes

We've been waiting for this place to open!  It's Japanese and Thai Curry.. almost like a Ramen house - style menu.. we had the shrimp Japanese curry and fish Thai curry - over white rice.. it was very delicious!  Definitely looking forward to exploring their menu more next time.. -- love the way you can customized the sweetness of the bobas!
Awesome curry kinda similar to coco house in the 808.  Flavor is good but portion are small.

Felt like curry so "Curry Hut" seemd like an obvious choice lol. It was fairly small but it didn't seem like a sit n eat kind of place. 

Apparently they just opened up prior to us coming in. Their grand opening was to be held a few days after our visit. That's what the staff told us, being that they were so nice and personable. Very friendly staff and because we were so excited to have curry they comped us a few lobster balls !! 

The food was good and very tasty. I like how they let you select/build your curry plate... from the type of meat to even the type of curry. This place is a must visit if you like curry... or if your a visitor from Hawaii looking for some good local grinds !!

A little pricey for the amount they give, but still worth it. We ordered to dine in and take out. We're pigs. ? Anyways, service was as amazing as their food. It was our first time and didn't know what the difference was. We were able to sample the sauces as well as the boba!!! Definitely plan on coming back.

So glad there's finally a Japanese curry place on my side of town! Same thing as zen curry in China town. You can pick your spice level and toppings. Recommend this place to anyone who doesn't want to drive all the way to China town for some curry. Their drinks are also really good! I'll definitely be back :)

Stopped by today to try this out.   It is a good concerpt.  You can order your meal on a base of white or brown rice or lettuce.    You then pick your meat and curry.    It had a very good flavor, was fresh and not too bad time wise to make.    Meat portions are generous.   My only disapointment was how little curry sauce was used.    They couod have peovided a bit more of the curry but I will definately try again.

This spot is the spot for those that live north side of vegas. Clean, superb food, excellent customer service and care, very warm environment. Will strongly recommend this spot. Reminds me of curry in Japan. Will make it back shortly. Thanks!!!
